other_tests.findings: Onion bulbs and loss of myelinated fibers, without inflammatory infiltrates.
Increased protein content (82 mg/dL) with normal cell count. Oligoclonal IgG bands restricted to CSF were detected.

other_tests.date: First Test: Not specified, Second Test: One month later
other_tests.findings: First: Normal. Second: Marked prolongation of P100 wave latency.
Slight pleocytosis of 12 white blood cells/ÂµL.

other_tests.date: At presentation: Not specified, Follow-up: Three years later
other_tests.findings: Multiple T2-hyperintense lesions without Gd enhancement at presentation; increased T2-lesion load and one Gd-enhancing lesion in the pons at follow-up.
Normal hearing on the left side with a 30 dB loss at 8 kHz on the right side.
73% right caloric paresis and 19% right directional preponderance.
Poor responses above 3,000 Hz but normal responses at low frequencies in the right ear.
Normal, with no abnormalities of absolute or interwave latencies.
Showed typical features of herpes simplex encephalitis.

other_tests.procedure_name: HSV PCR from brain biopsy and CSF

other_tests.changes_over_time: Normalized approximately 2 hours after the onset of tachycardia.

other_tests.findings: Wide complex tachycardia at a rate of 133 beats/min with pacer spikes
